history.text: hi
it has been a while since  I have viewed this movie. But I remember that it was good.
Do you think this film would have the same reviews today?
I did not know that Steve Jobs was involved in this film.
I didn't know that either. I think the reviews would still be as high today. Toy story was a classic
But as perfect as this ? almost 100%.
I think it has a unique story line that hasn't really been explored by any other movies in the way before or since
Yeah, you may have a point,  but you don't think that being the first computer-animated film did give the film a boost with the critics ?
I also think the fact that Woody's in it gives it a nostalgic feel for the older audience
He was a great character, Tom Hanks did give him a lot of personality.
That's true, it did have quite a bit of help with the critics for being first of it's kind
He did, he did a great job voice acting, and so did Tim Allen
I like how their characters started out at rivals but became friends as the film went on
It did give a twist to film, a twist that we don't see often in children movies.

I can
'
*i can't believe it's been over 20 years since it came out
It had a great introduction, I like how the everything falls in places,
How seamlessly they introduce us to a world where toys can talk to each other.
Definitely, and how some of the toys believe they really are something based on the toy that they are
Like how Buzz was convinced he was a space ranger
That is the charm of the film, it makes them even more human.
In comparison, the real humans humans in the movie seem one dimensional, they are less deep than the toys.
Yes, they definitely made the toys more interesting than the humans as a twist compared to other movies
I think the pizza planet scene was one of my favorites
It reminded me of someplace similar that I went to as a child

We did not have these in my childhood. the film has great action
 scenes
I like on how the film is constructed, there is not superfluous scene.
Yeah definitely, it has some great suspense but not too intense so little one's can enjoy it too
it is not overly suspenseful, but there is always something happening.
This was my favorite scene, a lot of action.
Yeah the ending was really good
I loved the toys reactions to finding out Andy got a puppy for CHristmas
It was a great ending.
What did you liked the most about the movie ?
Who was your favorite toy?
I think Mr. Potato Head was my favorite

I like Mr. Potatoe he was funny
.
I liked on how the integrate the real toy as a comedic device.
I liked the development of all the main characters, they all evolved by the end of the movie
That is my favorite part, there is a lot of character development in the movie.
Do you intend to see the movie again ?
They set it up nicely to have sequels
I might now that I've talked about it so much
Me too
My son likes the movie so maybe I'll have to pop it in for a movie night
Thanks for the conversation, have a noce day.

uid1response.feedback: The other user sometimes took a lot of time to respond.
